intro: Phlogacanthus jenkinsii, commonly known as the Jenkins' phlogacanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
